------=_Part_593229_1712234989.1473674904879
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="utf-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

 Hi Marcin,  
  I'll try to explain what these parameters do here.  
  NoveltySearch_P_min - when an individual's behavior is evaluated, its sparseness is computed and according to this threshold it is added to the archive or not. The sparseness has to be at least this big in order to enter the archive.  
  NoveltySearch_Dynamic_Pmin - this controls whether the threshold above is dynamic, i.e. can grow bigger and smaller with time. It is usually done to avoid adding too much behaviors to the archive too often.  
  NoveltySearch_No_Archiving_Stagnation_Treshold - sometimes you don't want to modify the Pmin immediately, but when the archive doesn't get new entries for some time. This parameter lets you control how much evaluations without archiving have to pass before the Pmin is altered.  
  NoveltySearch_Pmin_lowering_multiplier - this is what lowers the Pmin. It gets multiplied by it, so 0.9 would mean Pmin = Pmin * 0.9  NoveltySearch_Pmin_raising_multiplier - this is what raises the Pmin. It gets multiplied by it, so 1.1 would mean Pmin = Pmin * 1.1  
  NoveltySearch_Pmin_min - you don't want the Pmin to go all the way down to 0, so this is its minimum value. It will always be above that.  
  NoveltySearch_Quick_Archiving_Min_Evaluations - this is essentially the opposite of No_Archiving_Stagnation_Treshold. When the Pmin is very low, lots of individuals are added quickly to the archive. When this happens, you want to raise the Pmin. This controls how many such quick additions should happen before it's raised.  
  NoveltySearch_Recompute_Sparseness_Each - at every N evaluations, all individuals in the population have their sparseness recomputed. This is the N.  
  I'm not sure if all of these parameters are present in the papers, some of them are probably added by me at some point. I hope this explanation makes everything clear.  
  Peter  
 







 >-------- Оригинално писмо --------

 >От: "mzakidalski@... [neat]" neat@yahoogroups.com

 >Относно: [neat] question concerning MultiNEAT parameters

 >До:  

 >Изпратено на: 12.09.2016 07:50



  
 
  
   
   
    
      
      
     
Hi,
In multineat library there are the following parameters connected with Novelty Search:

    Novelty Search K // the K constant Novelty Search P min // Sparseness treshold. Add to the archive if above Novelty 
  Search Dynamic Pmin // Dynamic Pmin? Novelty 
  Search No Archiving Stagnation Treshold // How many evaluations should pass without adding to the archive
  


  // in order to lower Pmin Novelty Search Pmin lowering multiplier // How should it be multiplied (make it less than 1.0) Novelty Search Pmin min // Not lower than this value Novelty Search Quick Archiving Min Evaluations // How many one-after-another additions to the archive should
  


  // pass in order to raise Pmin Novelty Search Pmin raising multiplier // How should it be multiplied (make it more than 1.0) Novelty Search Recompute Sparseness Each // Per how many evaluations to recompute the sparseness of the population 
 
     
 
  
     
 Apart from K I am unable to identify those parameters (comments are taken from the source coude). Could I ask you for help? In which Novelty Search paper could I find the description of those parameters?  
     
 
  
     
 Regards,  
     
 Marcin Zakidalski
